registry.title: Global Switched Telephone Network (GSTN) Address Element Extensions in Email Services

record.description: Organization Name for Physical Delivery (example: ACME Inc)
Office Number for physical delivery (example: BLD2-44)
Office Name for physical delivery (example: Sales)
Street address for physical delivery (example: 45, Main Street)
Unformatted postal address for physical delivery (example: HWY 14, Km 94.5 - Loc. Redhill)
Unique postal name for physical delivery (example: ACMETELEX)
Local postal attributes for physical delivery (example: Entrance 3, 3rd floor, Suite 296)
Post Office Box for physical delivery
Postal ZIP code for physical delivery
Country Name for physical delivery
Indicates that the following GSTN telephone number is a facsimile device, and the message refers to the Internet Fax Service
To specify that the GSTN address refers to a voice mailbox that is intended to accept a VPIM message
To specify that the GSTN address refers to a voice device that is intended to be sent a voice message via an 'outdialing'
To specify that the GSTN address refers to a voice mailbox that is intended to be sent an AMIS (Audio Messaging Interchange Specification) voice mail message
The ITU T.30/T.33 subaddresses (facsimile service)
The optional ISDN sub-address
The optional further dialing sequence needed to access addional services (for example a menu' driven interface)
The personal name of the individual (origin to or recipient)
To specify the numeric optional AMIS sub-address element as described in "VPIM Addressing", [RFC3804]
To specify the numeric optional extension that identifies a particular VPIM mailbox as described in "VPIM Addressing", [RFC3804]
To specify the numeric optional personal Distribution list for a particular VPIM mailbox as described in "VPIM Addressing", [RFC3804]
